tool.name: ProcessModelResults

param.name: input_feature
param.dialogReference: Spatial feature to join the results against

param.name: feature_type
param.expression: Junctions | Pipes | Pump | Reservoir | Tank | Valve

param.name: aggregate
param.dialogReference: aggregate the results to a single row per id, or dont for discreet values.

tool.summary: Combines scenario output values (one or many) into fields in a feature class for analysis/display based on EXT_APP_FILTER outputs
tool.usage:
Combines scenarios from a model run, such as Flow and Pressure into columns for each scenario selected in a single model. Can either aggregate the values to a single average, or output as discrete timesteps.

Results will outer join each scenario, but it is limited to the spatial dataset as the input. So if you have a junctions feature with 10 junctions, the tool will only return those 10 junctions even if your EXT_APP_FILTER contains 1000 results. The missing joins are dropped.

The tool performs the join against the Time field, so you will be able to run different reporting times and return the common timestep.

Example would be using Model 1 with two scenarios [AVGOne, AVGTwo]. using a junction and two fields [Pressure, Head]. The result will return a feature class that combines these into a single feature.

Input must include the spatial feature to join to (junction, pipes, etc.) and the model to run against. If you have an open model it will load the scenarios, otherwise you can specify another model.

Results will look like the following based on the previous inputs

ID, Pressure_AVGOne, Head_AVGOne, Pressure_AVGTwo, Head_AVGTwo

If you do not aggregate, then there will be an additional field Timestamp between ID and the first data column
